## Quarto

Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished document. To learn more about Quarto see <https://quarto.org>.

## Running Code

When you click the **Render** button a document will be generated that includes both content and the output of embedded code. You can embed code like this:

```{r}
library(dplyr)
library(gt)
library(tableone)
library(kableExtra)

devtools::load_all()
```

\newpage

# `format_table` 

## Normal data

```{r}
#| tbl-cap: Test table 1
data <- dplyr::sample_n(iris, 10)

format_table(
  data = data,
  font_size = 20
  )
```

## Table 1 with `format_table`

```{r}
tbl1 <- tableone::CreateTableOne(
  data = iris
  )

format_table(
  data = tbl1,
  font_size = 20
  )
```

::: {.content-visible when-format="html"}

# `format_datatable` 

## Datatable without column filter

```{r}
#| tbl-colwidths: auto
data %>% 
  format_datatable()
```

## Datatable with column filter

```{r}
data %>% 
  format_datatable(cols_show = c("Species", "Sepal.Width"))
```

:::

# Standard functions

## kableExtra (latex test)

```{r}

data <- dplyr::sample_n(iris, 80)

data %>% 
  kableExtra:: kbl(
    booktabs = TRUE,
    longtable = TRUE,
    caption = "Test table 3"
  ) %>% 
  kableExtra::kable_styling(
    latex_options = c("repeat_header"),
    repeat_header_continued = "\\textit{(Continued on next page...)}",
    )
```
